title: Fasting boosts breast cancer therapy efficacy via glucocorticoid activation
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09869-0

Beneficial effects of fasting combined with endocrine therapy for oestrogen receptor-α-expressing breast cancers can be recapitulated using exogenous glu…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09869-0 Beneficial effects of fasting combined with endocrine therapy for oestrogen receptor-α-expressing breast cancers can be recapitulated using exogenous glucocorticoid receptor ligands instead of fasting to reduce harmful effects.

title: Erythropoietin receptor on cDC1s dictates immune tolerance
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09824-z

The tolerogenic activity of type 1 conventional dendritic cells (cDC1s) is determined by EPOR, which is preferentially expressed in cDC1s and induces ant…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09824-z The tolerogenic activity of type 1 conventional dendritic cells (cDC1s) is determined by EPOR, which is preferentially expressed in cDC1s and induces antigen-specific FOXP3-expressing regulatory T cells.

title: Human gut M cells resemble dendritic cells and present gluten antigen
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09829-8

An intestinal organoid model recapitulates human microfold (M) cell function and transcriptomic profiling and biochemical assays demonstrate that M cells…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09829-8 An intestinal organoid model recapitulates human microfold (M) cell function and transcriptomic profiling and biochemical assays demonstrate that M cells uptake and present antigens to the immune system via the class II major histocompatibility complex.

title: Cross-regulation of [2Fe–2S] cluster synthesis by ferredoxin-2 and frataxin
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09822-1

A finely balanced ratio of ferredoxin-2 (FDX2) and frataxin (FXN) is essential for the synthesis of iron–sulfur clusters, and interventions targeting thi…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09822-1 A finely balanced ratio of ferredoxin-2 (FDX2) and frataxin (FXN) is essential for the synthesis of iron–sulfur clusters, and interventions targeting this ratio could provide a way to treat related diseases, such as Friedreich’s ataxia.

title: Sterilization and contraception increase lifespan across vertebrates
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09836-9

Data collected from zoos and aquariums worldwide show that hormonal contraception or permanent surgical sterilization in mammals increase life expectancy…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09836-9 Data collected from zoos and aquariums worldwide show that hormonal contraception or permanent surgical sterilization in mammals increase life expectancy, with different mechanisms in males and females.

title: Hot droughts in the Amazon provide a window to a future hypertropical climate
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09728-y

Thirty years of forest demographic data, combined with recent ecophysiological measurements, reveal that intense Amazon droughts sharply increase tree mo…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09728-y Thirty years of forest demographic data, combined with recent ecophysiological measurements, reveal that intense Amazon droughts sharply increase tree mortality once soil moisture falls below a threshold, and that these hot droughts will become more frequent and intense as Earth warms towards hypertropical conditions.

body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09834-x Cells can sense mitochondrial damage through signalling via an unimported mitochondrial targeting sequence.

body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09839-6 Neutrophil-derived IL-1β has a role in preserving lipid stores during metabolic stress.

title: An RNA splicing system that excises DNA transposons from animal mRNAs
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09853-8

A new type of mRNA splicing mechanism discovered in Caenorhabditis elegans that detects and removes inverted repeats also occurs in human cells, thereby …
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09853-8 A new type of mRNA splicing mechanism discovered in Caenorhabditis elegans that detects and removes inverted repeats also occurs in human cells, thereby providing another strategy to protect against the negative effects of transposable elements.

title: Uncovering the role of LINE-1 in the evolution of lung adenocarcinoma
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09825-y

Lung adenocarcinomas bearing the ID2 mutational signature display increased LINE-1 retrotransposon activity, which contributes to their fast evolutionary…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09825-y Lung adenocarcinomas bearing the ID2 mutational signature display increased LINE-1 retrotransposon activity, which contributes to their fast evolutionary dynamics and aggressive phenotype.

title: Somatic evolution following cancer treatment in normal tissue
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09792-4

High-depth sequencing of non-cancerous tissue from patients with metastatic cancer reveals single-base mutational signatures of alcohol, smoking and canc…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09792-4 High-depth sequencing of non-cancerous tissue from patients with metastatic cancer reveals single-base mutational signatures of alcohol, smoking and cancer treatments, and reveals how exogenous factors, including cancer therapies, affect somatic cell evolution.

Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09837-8

Analysis of effect sizes of vegetation spillovers from protected areas in Australia shows that 71% of over 3,063 analysed protected areas had a positive …
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09837-8 Analysis of effect sizes of vegetation spillovers from protected areas in Australia shows that 71% of over 3,063 analysed protected areas had a positive spillover effect, and that these effects covary with protected area management type.

title: Laser-based conversion electron Mössbauer spectroscopy of <sup>229</sup>ThO<sub>2</sub>
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09776-4

Laser-induced conversion electron Mössbauer spectroscopy, which detects electrons emitted by 229Th nuclei in a thin ThO2 sample excited by vacuum ultravi…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09776-4 Laser-induced conversion electron Mössbauer spectroscopy, which detects electrons emitted by 229Th nuclei in a thin ThO2 sample excited by vacuum ultraviolet light, is demonstrated, opening the possibility of a conversion-electron-based nuclear clock.

body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09828-9 The ALPK1 agonist UDSP-Hep stimulates tumour-cell antigen presentation, macrophage–DC cross-priming and differentiation of protective memory T cells.

title: Mutations in mitochondrial ferredoxin FDX2 suppress frataxin deficiency
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09821-2

A forward genetic screen in Caenorhabditis elegans reveals that decreased levels of the ferredoxin FDX2 suppress the loss of frataxin in worms and in mic…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09821-2 A forward genetic screen in Caenorhabditis elegans reveals that decreased levels of the ferredoxin FDX2 suppress the loss of frataxin in worms and in mice by relief of FDX2 inhibition of frataxin-stimulated NFS1 activity.

body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03946-0 Surgeon George Hanna is developing a non-invasive test to catch one of the deadliest cancers before it’s too late.

title: A giant catalogue of microscopic species across Denmark
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03819-6

The Microflora Danica project has catalogued the microbial diversity of environmental habitats across Denmark and established an improved taxonomic refer…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03819-6 The Microflora Danica project has catalogued the microbial diversity of environmental habitats across Denmark and established an improved taxonomic reference database. As well as providing a special record of nitrogen-oxidizing microorganisms, the data set serves as a national baseline for tracking future microbial responses to factors such as land-use change and global warming.

title: A simple slipknot for precise force control
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03829-4

The tension of conventional surgical sutures can affect wound healing and is dependent on the surgeon’s experience. Imaging and simulations reveal that s…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03829-4 The tension of conventional surgical sutures can affect wound healing and is dependent on the surgeon’s experience. Imaging and simulations reveal that slipknots can reproducibly store and release force, enabling precise and consistent surgical knotting without the need for electronic sensors or specialized equipment.

The emission of photons by excited nuclei has been explored for timekeeping and sensing, but nuclear processes that eject electrons offer practical advan…
body: Nature, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03732-y The emission of photons by excited nuclei has been explored for timekeeping and sensing, but nuclear processes that eject electrons offer practical advantages.
